title: Diabetes Patient Insulin Management Education: Practitioner Competency Enhancement Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of diabetes pathophysiology and foundational nursing skills
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education for large learner groups comprising licensed nurses and unlicensed assistive personnel. Flexible learning environment provided through Bring Your Own Device (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can describe three structured protocols that minimize cognitive load during insulin administration for diabetic patients
Learners can perform insulin dosage adjustments according to patient conditions (e.g., pre/post-meal, blood glucose levels) in a simulation environment with 80% accuracy
Learners can present a four-step workflow for blood glucose monitoring and dietary management through collaboration scenarios with unlicensed assistive personnel
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
